firmware_notes: Compatible con KAM original (1986), KAM Plus (1994-2003), versiones de firmware 2.x a 8.x. Algunos comandos requieren versiones específicas o módulos opcionales (PACTOR, G-TOR, GPS).

Mode Switching.help:
Switches the TNC to AX.25 Packet mode.

All packet parameters (PACLEN, MAXFRAME, etc.) become active.

Switches to CW (Morse code) mode.

Optional speed parameter sets WPM (5-99).
Examples:
  CW (current speed)
  CW 20 (20 WPM)

The TNC will decode received CW and encode typed text as CW. Adjust CWSPEED and CWTONE for best results.

Switches to RTTY (Radio Teletype) Baudot mode.

Optional baud parameter (5-300 on HF).
Example: RTTY 45

Check RBAUD, SHIFT, and INVERT settings before use.

Switches to ASCII RTTY mode.

Optional baud parameter.
Common: 110, 300.

Check ASCBAUD settings.

Switches to AMTOR mode.

No parameter: standby mode
With selcall (4 chars): initiate ARQ call

Examples:
  AMTOR (standby)
  AMTOR DGKV (call DGKV)

Use Ctrl+C T for FEC mode.

Switches to PACTOR mode (requires PACTOR option).

No parameter: standby
With callsign: initiate link

Example: PACTOR EA7HQL

Switches to G-TOR mode (requires G-TOR firmware).

No parameter: standby
With callsign: initiate link

G-TOR is faster than AMTOR, slower than PACTOR.

Switches to NAVTEX marine broadcast reception mode.

Receives marine weather and navigation warnings.

Switches to Weather FAX reception mode.

Receives weather maps and charts.

Mode Switching.desc: Exit current mode to cmd: prompt
Mode Switching.help:
Exits the current operating mode (CW/RTTY/AMTOR converse) back to the cmd: prompt.

Sequence: Ctrl+C, wait 300ms, then X + Enter.
Sends Ctrl+C to exit converse mode. In some modes you may also need to type X to confirm.

Connection.help:
Initiates an AX.25 connection to the specified station.

Examples:
  C DG2GSV
  C DB0UAL VIA DG2GSV
  C DB0FHN VIA DB0UAL,DB0RBS

The TNC sends SABM frames and waits for UA. If no response after RETRY attempts, it gives up.
Sends a DISC frame to end the current AX.25 connection gracefully.

Enters converse mode. Everything you type is packetized and transmitted.
Press Ctrl+C to return to command mode.

Shorthand: K

Enters transparent mode. Data is sent exactly as typed, with no special character interpretation.

To exit transparent mode, send the escape sequence (usually Ctrl+C Ctrl+C Ctrl+C with pauses).

When ON, displays '*** CONNECTED to {call}' message.

Default: ON

Sets mode to enter when connection established.

CONV - converse mode
TRANS - transparent mode

Default: CONV

Monitoring.help:
Sets the monitoring level for displaying packets on the radio channel.

Levels:
  0 — monitor off
  1 — only connected I-frames
  2 — + unconnected I-frames
  3 — + connect/disconnect frames (SABM, DISC, UA, DM)
  4 — + supervisory frames (RR, RNR, REJ)
  5 — + all UI frames
  6 — all frames including beacon and digipeat

Default: 0 (KAM dual-port: 0/0)

Controls whether monitored traffic is shown during active connections.

KAM is dual-port: MCOM ON/OFF sets HF/VHF independently.

Default: OFF

When ON, only packets from connected stations are monitored.

Default: OFF

When ON, monitors packets even from connected stations.

Default: ON
Displays a list of stations heard recently with timestamps and byte counts.

Controls whether packet headers are displayed on a separate line from data.

Default: ON

When ON, shows packets marked as digipeated.

Default: OFF

When ON, adds timestamp to monitored packets.

Default: OFF

Station Setup.help:
Sets the callsign used for all transmissions.

Examples:
  MY EA7HQL
  MY EA7HQL-5

SSID (-0 to -15) can be appended. Default SSID is -0.
You MUST set this before connecting.

KAM dual-port: MYCALL sets both HF and VHF.

Sets alternate identifier for digipeating.

Example: MYALIAS MADRID-3

Stations can digipeat via MYCALL or MYALIAS.
Must be different from MYCALL, MYNODE, MYPBBS, MYGATE.

KAM dual-port: MYALIAS {HF}/{VHF}

Default: MYCALL

Sets callsign for KA-NODE networking.

Convention: MYCALL-7

Must be different from MYCALL, MYALIAS, MYPBBS, MYGATE.

Default: MYCALL

Sets callsign for personal mailbox (PBBS).

Convention: MYCALL-4

Must be different from MYCALL, MYALIAS, MYNODE, MYGATE.

Default: none

Sets callsign for HF/VHF gateway operation.

Convention: MYCALL-2

Must be different from MYCALL, MYALIAS, MYNODE, MYPBBS.

Default: none

Controls whether the TNC echoes back characters you type.

ECHO ON  — TNC echoes input
ECHO OFF — no echo (use if terminal has local echo)

Default: ON

Adds LF after each CR received.

Default: OFF

Enables XON/XOFF software flow control between TNC and terminal.

Default: ON

Sets mode at power-up.

NONE = Packet mode (default)
Other values enter that mode automatically.

Default: NONE

Sets serial interface mode.

TERMINAL — normal human operation
KISS — KISS protocol for programs
HOST — Kantronics host mode

Default: TERMINAL

Selects default radio port for commands.

HF - port 1 (all modes)
VHF - port 2 (packet only)

Default: VHF

Saves current parameters to EEPROM for power-on restoration.

Without PERM, changes revert to defaults at power-off.

Note: With Battery Backup or SmartWatch, some parameters auto-save.

Sets the internal clock.

Format: YY=year, MM=month, DD=day, HH=hour, MM=minute, SS=second

Example: DAYTIME 250214173000 (Feb 14, 2025, 17:30:00)

Packet Timing.help:
Delay between keying TX and sending data.

Values: 0-120 (10ms units)
Default: 30 (300ms)

KAM dual-port: TXDELAY {HF}/{VHF}

Guidelines:
  Direct VHF: 20-30
  Via repeater: 40-60
  HF: 30-50

Seconds to wait for ACK before retransmitting.

Values: 1-15
Default: 3

KAM dual-port: FRACK {HF}/{VHF}

Guidelines:
  VHF direct: 3
  Via digipeater: 5-7
  HF: 8-15

Max retransmission attempts before disconnect.

Values: 0-15
Default: 10

KAM dual-port: RETRY {HF}/{VHF}

CSMA persistence. Higher = more aggressive transmit.

Values: 0-255
Default: 63

KAM dual-port: PERSIST {HF}/{VHF}

Probability = (PERSIST + 1) / 256
  63 = 25% (shared channels)
  255 = always transmit (point-to-point)

Time between PERSIST checks.

Values: 0-255 (10ms units)
Default: 10 (100ms)

KAM dual-port: SLOTTIME {HF}/{VHF}

Time slots to wait after DCD drops before transmitting.

Values: 0-255
Default: 0

KAM dual-port: DWAIT {HF}/{VHF}

Each slot = SLOTTIME duration.

Packet Advanced.help:
Maximum data bytes per AX.25 I-frame.

Values: 0-255 (0 = 256)
Default: 128

KAM dual-port: PACLEN {HF}/{VHF}

Guidelines:
  HF (300 baud): 40-80
  VHF (1200 baud): 128
  VHF (9600 baud): 255

Smaller = fewer retransmissions on noisy links.

Max unacknowledged I-frames before waiting for ACK.

Values: 1-7
Default: 4

KAM dual-port: MAXFRAME {HF}/{VHF}

Guidelines:
  HF: 1-2
  VHF simplex: 3-4
  VHF full-duplex: 7

When ON, TNC acts as a digipeater for MYCALL and MYALIAS.

KAM dual-port: DIGIPEAT ON/OFF sets HF/VHF independently.

Default: ON

When ON, passes packets even with CRC errors (for monitoring).

KAM dual-port: PASSALL ON/OFF

Default: OFF

When ON, allows 8-bit data in converse mode.

If terminal has problems in converse, try OFF.

Default: ON

Max number of simultaneous packet connections.

Values: 0-10
Default: 1

KAM can handle multiple connections on HF and VHF.

Sets max users per port and port configuration.

10/10 - HF and VHF both active (default)
0/20 - VHF only (20 streams)
20/0 - HF only (20 streams)

Default: 10/10

When ON, adds CR at end of packet data.

Default: OFF

Beacon & Unproto.help:
Sets beacon transmission:

EVERY n - send beacon every n×10 seconds
AFTER n - send once after n×10 sec of inactivity

Values: 0-250 (0 = off)
Default: 0

KAM dual-port: BEACON EVERY/AFTER {HF}/{VHF}

Example: BEACON EVERY 90 (send every 15 minutes)

Sets the text for beacon packets. Max 120 characters.

Example: BTEXT EA7HQL VHF Packet in Madrid

KAM dual-port: Set separately for HF/VHF using BLT command.

Default: empty

Sets destination for beacons and unconnected packets.

Examples:
  UNPROTO CQ
  UNPROTO BEACON VIA WIDE2-2
  UNPROTO APRS VIA RELAY,WIDE

KAM dual-port: UNPROTO sets both ports.

Default: CQ

Immediately sends an identification packet.

Useful for sending final ID before shutdown.

When ON, sends ID beacon every hour.

KAM dual-port: HID ON/OFF

Default: OFF

Connect Messages.help:
Message sent when someone connects to you. Max 120 characters.

Example: CTEXT Welcome to EA7HQL - I'm QRT, leave msg

Default: empty

Controls behavior when station connects:

ON - send CTEXT, enter converse
OFF - no message
PBBS - redirect to personal mailbox
DISC - send CTEXT then disconnect

Default: ON

When ON, sounds terminal bell when connection established.

Default: OFF

CW Parameters.help:
Sets the CW sending and receiving speed in words per minute.

Values: 5-99
Default: 20

Common speeds:
  15 – slow, comfortable for beginners
  20 – standard QSO speed
  30+ – contest/advanced

Sets the receive CW filter center frequency.

Values: 200-2000 Hz
Default: 750

Match this to your transceiver's sidetone frequency for best decoding.

CW Parameters.desc: CW ID at end of transmission
CW Parameters.help:
When ON, the TNC sends your callsign in CW at the end of each transmission.

Default: OFF

Adjusts the CW dash-to-dot ratio.

Values: 10-90
Default: 50 (standard 3:1 ratio)

Values >50 produce heavier (longer) dashes.

Sets CW decoding polarity.

CWNORMAL ON — standard polarity (mark = high tone)
CWNORMAL OFF — inverted polarity

Try toggling if you can hear CW but it decodes as garbage.

Default: ON

Sets Farnsworth character spacing. Characters are sent at CWSPEED but spacing between them is at CWFARNSWORTH speed.

Values: 0-99 (0 = disabled)
Default: 0

Useful for CW learning: set CWSPEED 20 and CWFARNSWORTH 10.

Sets the CW receive filter bandwidth.

NARROW — ~100 Hz (best selectivity, requires accurate tuning)
MEDIUM — ~200 Hz (good balance)
WIDE — ~500 Hz (easier tuning, more noise)

Default: MEDIUM

RTTY/ASCII Parameters.help:
Sets default RTTY baud rate for Baudot mode.

Common: 45 (standard amateur HF), 50, 57, 75.
Max 300 on HF port.

Baud/WPM correlation:
  45 baud = 60 WPM
  50 baud = 67 WPM
  75 baud = 100 WPM

Default: 45

Sets default baud for ASCII mode.

Standard: 110 or 300.

Default: 110

Sets RTTY shift.

Common values:
170 - standard amateur
200 - European commercial
425 - wide
850 - very wide

Custom values 1-999 allowed.

Default: 170

Inverts the sense of mark and space tones.

Try toggling if you receive garbled text. Some stations use inverted polarity.

Default: OFF

Automatically inserts CR after n characters.

0 = disabled.

Default: 72

ON = European ITA2
OFF = US TTY code

Default: OFF

Sets mark tone frequency.

Values: 1000-3000 Hz
Default: 2125

Note: MARK, SPACE, and SHIFT are related. Setting any two determines the third.

Sets space tone frequency.

Values: 1000-3000 Hz
Default: 2295

Note: MARK, SPACE, and SHIFT are related.

AMTOR Parameters.help:
Initiates an AMTOR ARQ (Automatic Repeat Request) connection.

The selcall is a 4-character code derived from the target station's callsign.

Example:
  AMTOR DGKV

Sets your 4-character AMTOR selective call.

Derivation: First letter of callsign + last 3 letters.
Example: W0XI → WWXI, DC7XJ → DCXJ

Default: none

Sets your 7-character AMTOR selective call (for SITOR).

Default: none

In AMTOR standby, press Ctrl+C then T to start FEC broadcast.

FEC is a one-way mode – no acknowledgement from the receiving station. Good for CQ calls and broadcasts.

Places the TNC in AMTOR standby, listening for incoming ARQ calls addressed to your selcall.

Also receives FEC broadcasts.

When ON, allows monitoring of other stations' AMTOR ARQ links.

Default: OFF

Gateway & Networking.help:
Enables HF/VHF gateway operation.

Packets received on one port are digipeated to the other if MYGATE is in path.

WARNING: Gateway operation requires attended operation per FCC rules.

Default: OFF

List of callsigns NOT allowed to use gateway.

Use to exclude stations without privileges on both bands.

Default: empty

KA-NODE.help:
When connected to KA-NODE, requests heard station list.

SHORT - callsigns only
LONG - includes paths

This is a directive sent from converse mode.

When connected to KA-NODE, displays list of known nodes.

Shows node callsigns, aliases, and quality.

This is a directive sent from converse mode.

When connected to KA-NODE, initiates connection to station on the OTHER port.

Example: Connect to HF node, then XCONNECT to VHF station.

This is a directive sent from converse mode.

Sets greeting message for KA-NODE.

Default: empty

PBBS (Personal Mailbox).help:
Sets mailbox buffer size in kilobytes.

Values: 0-80 (0 = disabled)
Default: 0

Example: PBBS 40 (40KB mailbox)

When ON, STA LED blinks when you have mail.

Default: OFF

Sets greeting message for personal mailbox.

Default: empty

Max simultaneous mailbox connections.

Values: 0-10
Default: 1

Timeout for idle mailbox users (10 sec units).

Values: 0-250
Default: 30 (5 minutes)

Sets callsign allowed remote SYSOP access to PBBS.

Default: none

Sets password for remote SYSOP access.

Default: empty

APRS & UI Digipeating.help:
Enables UI frame digipeating for listed aliases.

Example: UIDIGI ON RELAY,WIDE,TRACE

Stations can digipeat via these aliases.

Default: OFF

Enables New Paradigm WIDEn-n digipeating.

Example: UIFLOOD WIDE,7,ID

alias - base alias (e.g., WIDE)
max - max n value (typically 7)
ID/NOID - insert MYCALL or not

Supports WIDEn-n path reduction.

Enables New Paradigm TRACEn-n digipeating with callsign insertion.

Example: UITRACE TRACE,7

Inserts MYCALL in path for tracing.

When ON, adds random delay to UI digipeats to reduce collisions.

Default: ON

When ON, processes UI packets based on destination SSID.

Default: OFF

GPS & Position.help:
Sets AUX port baud for GPS input.

Values: 0 (off), 1200, 2400, 4800, 9600
Default: 0

GPS must output NMEA sentences.

Sends initialization string to GPS receiver.

Use Ctrl+N for multiple sentences.

Example: GPSINIT $PMGNST,NMEA<Ctrl+N>

Format string for GPS position beacons.

Use %LAT%, %LON%, %ALT% placeholders.

Example: GPSTEXT !%LAT%/%LON%>Comment

Special Characters.help:
Sets character to return to command mode from converse.

Default: $03 (Ctrl+C)

Sets the character that cancels current input line.

Default: $18 (Ctrl+X)

Sets the character that cancels current packet.

Default: $19 (Ctrl+Y)

Sets the character that redisplays current input line.

Default: $12 (Ctrl+R)

Character to switch between HF/VHF streams in converse.

Default: $7C (|)

Type | to toggle between ports.

Serial Port.help:
Sets RS-232 terminal baud rate.

Common values:
0 - autobaud
300, 1200, 2400, 4800, 9600, 19200

Default: 0 (autobaud)

Use RESTART after changing.

Sets serial port parity.

Default: NONE

Display.help:
Shows TNC parameter values.

Classes:
  (none) - all settings
  A - async/RS232
  C - character/special
  F - firmware version
  H - health/statistics
  I - ID parameters
  L - link/timing
  M - monitoring
  R - RTTY/AMTOR
  T - transmit timing

Single parameter: DISP PACLEN

Enters calibration mode for adjusting transmitter audio levels.

The TNC transmits alternating tones. Press any key to exit.

Displays current connection status, streams, and channel information.

Shows who you're connected to and on which port.
Displays firmware version and build information.

Reset & Restore.help:
Resets ALL parameters to factory defaults.

WARNING: Erases callsign and all settings.

Hard reset: Power off, hold front panel button, power on.

Restores parameters from the last SAVE command.

Only works if SAVE was used previously.

Saves current parameters for RESTORE command.

Different from PERM - this is a temporary save.

Special Keys.help: Sends Ctrl+C (0x03) to return to the cmd: prompt from converse or data mode.
Sends End of Transmission character (0x04). Used in some file transfer protocols.
Sends ESC (0x1B). Some TNCs use this for special functions.
Sends a serial BREAK signal. Used for autobaud detection or hardware reset on some TNCs.

connectors.Computer Port: DB-25 RS-232 (DTE). Pin 2: TxD (out to computer), Pin 3: RxD (in from computer), Pin 4: RTS (out), Pin 5: CTS (in), Pin 7: GND, Pin 8: DCD (out, link status), Pin 20: DTR (out).
connectors.Radio Port 1 (HF): DB-9 female. Pin 1: TXA (AFSK out, 10mV-3V p-p adjustable), Pin 2: XCD (ext carrier detect in), Pin 3: PTT (out, active low), Pin 4: CW KEY/CTRL (out), Pin 5: RXA (audio in, 10K impedance), Pin 6: GND, Pin 7: FSK (out, TTL), Pin 9: GND.
connectors.Radio Port 2 (VHF): DB-9 male. Pin 1: TXA (AFSK out), Pin 2: XCD (ext carrier detect in), Pin 3: PTT (out, active low), Pin 4: CTRL (out), Pin 5: RXA (audio in), Pin 6: GND, Pin 7: FSK (out, TTL), Pin 9: GND.
connectors.AUX Port: DB-9. RS-232 DTE port for GPS, weather stations, or NET/ROM node stacking. Can be configured with GPSPORT or NBAUD commands.
connectors.Power: 2.1mm coaxial, center positive, +12V DC (10-16V acceptable), 300mA typical, 500mA max.

notes.dual_port_commands: Many KAM commands are dual-port with format: COMMAND {HF}/{VHF}. Examples: TXDELAY 30/25, MONITOR 4/0, BEACON EVERY 0/90. Set independently for each port.
notes.firmware_history: KAM original (1986-1994), KAM Plus (1994-2003) with PACTOR. KAM XL (2000+) with DSP, G-TOR, PSK31. Version 8.2 (1995) added New Paradigm APRS digipeating.
notes.ka_node: KA-NODE is Kantronics' network node system. Different from NET/ROM but similar concept. Uses MYNODE callsign (typically MYCALL-7).
notes.gateway_warning: Gateway operation (HF↔VHF) requires attended operation per FCC Part 97 rules. Use LLIST to exclude stations without dual-band privileges.
notes.kiss_mode: To enter KISS: INTFACE KISS, RESTART. To exit KISS: send 0xC0 0xFF 0xC0, or power cycle.
notes.battery_backup: Optional battery backup or SmartWatch retains settings without PERM. Check jumpers and battery installation in manual.
